New Records: Christian Eriksen tied his country's all-time record by making his 132nd international appearance.
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored his first goal of the tournament after 18 minutes.
Morten Hjulmand equalized for Denmark with a superb shot from outside the area on 34 minutes.
Phil Foden hit the post with a left-foot effort from the edge of the area.
Trent Alexander-Arnold was removed early in the second half and replaced by Conor Gallagher.
Foden was substituted for Jarrod Bowen, Bukayo Saka was replaced by Eberechi Eze, and Harry Kane was substituted for Ollie Watkins.
Ollie Watkins had a shot blocked by Kasper Schmeichel after running onto a through ball from Jude Bellingham.
Mikkel Damsgaard's long-range effort was parried by Jordan Pickford.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg's shot caused trouble for Jordan Pickford due to the poor surface conditions.
Post-Match Reflections: The outcome will raise further questions about Gareth Southgate's approach, particularly the lack of fluidity between Phil Foden and Jude Bellingham.
The reaction from England's public and press is unlikely to be positive, indicating that Southgate and his team have work to do.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The poor surface conditions affected the game, causing unpredictable bounces.
